qas.question: How many people left the state for the U.S. between 2000-2005?
In which city is there a large number of undocumented immigrants?
Is the population density the highest or lowest of any Mexican state?
Which are the largest two cities in the state?

context: During the period from 2000–2005 it is estimated that <a0_0>49,722<a0_0/> people left the state for the United States. Some 82,000 people are thought to have immigrated to the state from 2000–2005 mainly coming from Veracruz (17.6%), United States (16.2%), Durango (13.2%), Coahuila (8.0%) and Chiapas (4.5%). It is believed that there is a large number of undocumented immigrants in that state the come from Central and South America which mainly settle in <a1_0>Ciudad Juárez<a1_0/>. According to the 2005 census, the population grew 1.06% from 2000 to 2005. The state has an uneven settlement of people and the <a2_0>lowest<a2_0/> population density of any Mexican state; according to the 2005 census there were 12 people per km2. Of all the 3,241,444 people in the state, two-thirds (2,072,129) live in the cities of <a3_0>Ciudad Juárez and Chihuahua<a3_0/>. Only three other cities have populations over 100,000: Parral 101,147, Cuauhtémoc 105,725, and Delicias 108,187.
